title: Pre-Health Thursday: The Extracurricular Edge for Med School | University of Central Florida Events
text:
Ever wondered how your extracurricular activities can give you a competitive edge in your medical school applications? This workshop, presented by Maggie Rose, assistant director of admissions at Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, is designed for pre-med students who want to strategically leverage their activities to strengthen their medical school applications. You'll learn how to effectively highlight shadowing experiences, research projects, volunteer work and leadership roles that demonstrate your commitment to medicine. We'll cover strategies for showcasing the skills that medical school admissions committees prioritize and discuss how to articulate your experiences in personal statements and interviews.
Please RSVP on Handshake.
